subject: The Skinny: Thurs. April 12, 2007
body:
CBSNews.com

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






Hunt For Voter Fraud Comes Up 
Short 
      
The Justice Department's five-year push to find evidence of widespread 
      voter fraud comes up mostly empty. 
      The political fallout from the 
      administration's decision to extend the tours of U.S. troops - and how 
      the troops reacted to the news.
And remembering Kurt Vonnegut. 
      Joel Roberts has the highlights of the day's headlines.  More...


Joel Robertstheskinny@cbs.com
